panels.title: thanos Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{monitor="global",type="thanos"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{monitor="global",type="thanos"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="thanos"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{monitor="global",type="thanos"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="thanos"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{monitor="global",type="thanos"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="thanos"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{monitor="global",type="thanos"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="thanos"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Thanos compactor is responsible for compaction of Prometheus series data into blocks, which are stored in GCS buckets.
It also handles downsampling. This SLI monitors compaction operations and compaction failures.

panels.content:
### Description

Thanos query gathers the data needed to evaluate Prometheus queries from multiple underlying prometheus and thanos instances.
This SLI monitors the Thanos query HTTP interface. 5xx responses are considered failures.

### Description

Thanos store will respond to Thanos Query (and other) requests for historical data. This historical data is kept in
GCS buckets. This SLI monitors the Thanos StoreAPI GRPC endpoint. GRPC error responses are considered to be service-level failures.

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="thanos"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", type="thanos"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", type="thanos"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", type="thanos"} / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", type="thanos"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (env, environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        go_memstats_alloc_bytes{type="thanos"}
      )
      /
      sum by (env, environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{type="thanos"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="thanos"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="thanos"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="thanos"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="thanos"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="thanos"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      go_memstats_alloc_bytes{type="thanos"}
      / on(env, environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, pod) group_left()
      topk by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, pod) (1,
        container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container=~"gitlab-pages|gitlab-workhorse|kas|registry|thanos-store",type="thanos"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{type="thanos", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{type="thanos", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{type="thanos"} or instance:node_memory_utilisation:ratio{type="thanos"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{type="thanos"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{type="thanos"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{type="thanos"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="thanos"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is saturated, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="thanos"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)
